body_html:
I agree with @martinwicke. TensorBoard has always been committed to keeping its footprint tiny, because TensorFlow depends on it. It's relatively free in terms of dependencies and offers much value.

The only KI with our pip structure right now is tensorflow/tensorboard#588 where we'll likely need to vendor html5lib and bleach to guarantee no diamond conflicts.
body_text:
I agree with @martinwicke. TensorBoard has always been committed to keeping its footprint tiny, because TensorFlow depends on it. It's relatively free in terms of dependencies and offers much value.
The only KI with our pip structure right now is tensorflow/tensorboard#588 where we'll likely need to vendor html5lib and bleach to guarantee no diamond conflicts.
body:
I agree with @martinwicke. TensorBoard has always been committed to keeping its footprint tiny, because TensorFlow depends on it. It's relatively free in terms of dependencies and offers much value.

The only KI with our pip structure right now is https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorboard/issues/588 where we'll likely need to vendor html5lib and bleach to guarantee no diamond conflicts.
